channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dip in tarmac o/s 122 Rydal Drive, B'Heath, 27th August
item.description:
Dip in tarmac o/s 122 Rydal Drive, B'Heath - this was reported 6 months ago but caller does not have a ref no...says this has been marked up in green but no-one has been back. Lady would like to know what is happening as people are tripping over this.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 122, Rydal Drive, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car in street, 27th August
item.description:
Car has been parked in same position for over 4 months. Car is not in good condition, number plate is hanging off, wheels are flat.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Rainham Close, Avery Hill, London

item.title: Car abandoned in a permit holders only road, 27th August
item.description:
This car has been here about a month and had no permit and had not moved. It's been collecting parking tickets and taking up one of the valuable parking spaces used by residents who have paid for permit parking in the area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crumpsall Street, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Longfield Crescent, Forest Hill, London

item.title: Dumped pedal cycle frame O/S Blackfen Community Library, 27th August
item.description:
Further to your report number 8076231 stating that this problem has been resolved. It has not. This pedal cycle frame secured by D lock to the cycle parking bay outside the Community Library is as you can see from the photos still in situ. Can you please action my request to remove it as soon as possible please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Blackfen Road, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Electrical buzzing noise at night, 27th August
item.description:
There is not an issue with the light not working on this identified lampost BUT there wasn't an appropriate item to select to get to this area to report a possible fault. For the past couple of days there appears to be an electrical/high pitched pulsing noise coming from the light of this lamppost outside my house. I'm not sure if it's something that needs investigation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 90, Palace Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping of 2 mattresses., 27th August
item.description:
Fly-tipping of mattresses at 35-51. Resident called last week to report, but no action has been taken. Please remove ASAP.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Trederwen Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Dead Fox Cub, 27th August
item.description:
There is a dead fox cub on the pavement, it’s appeared overnight it was not there yesterday I’m sharing a what3words address to help you find this specific location. Tap to see exactly where it is: ///rate.flame.bells https://w3w.co/rate.flame.bells
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich Road, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flags hanging, flapping off every bridge on the M2 with racist banners, 27th August
item.description:
These banners are hanging off every bridge over each lane on each side of the bridge they are causing distraction and rage at the racist graffiti on every bridge and gantry over the M2 from the beginning in Kent right up to the Blackwall tunnel. All must be removed. It would appear to be a deliberate provocation to people who are not English.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellan Close, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, significant rubbish, grass not cut all summer, 27th August
item.description:
The heath area opposite 4 Longleigh Lane has become something of a dumping ground. Other parts of the Heath have been cut and maintained but this part has been left to become significantly overgrown. As a result we have had sinks, old prams and items of furniture dumped on it together with general litter. The length of the grass makes it difficult for litter to be picked up. I have removed some fly tipping items myself and put them in the skip on my driveway but it needs some significant attention as is now becoming a health hazard. With many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Longleigh Lane, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet
